ground_truth: Mickey, reacting, hits his forehead and starts pounding the door again as the movie cuts to a beautiful snow-covered church downtown, complete with courtyard and wrought-iron fence. A pedestrian walks by with an umbrella. The music continues as the film moves inside, where the choir is seen singing behind an altar glowing warm gold. A fairly large congregation sits in darkened pews as the film cuts to the back, where Mickey, his arms crossed, stands underneath some stained-glass windows, watching and listening to the inspiring music. The choir continues to sing as the movie cuts to Father Flynn in his office. He picks up some large, heavy books from a shelf near his window and walks over to Mickey, who's standing near his desk, already holding several tomes. Father Flynn puts the books on top of Mickey's pile; Mickey, flipping through the top one, awkwardly carries his bundle to the door. Next is seen a close-up of a painting of Jesus Christ on the cross, complete with crown of thorns and holy expression. The hymn plays on, loudly, as the camera moves back, revealing Mickey, standing outside a barber shop window, looking at the Christ, playing and shuffling from side to side to get its eyes' 3-D effect. Mickey turns from the window, shrugging, and starts to walk down the street, past a fruit and vegetable store with open-air-displayed flowers, past several briskly moving pedestrians. With the hymn still playing, the screen goes black briefly. Mickey opens the door, the light from a hallway illuminating him. He's just entered his apartment. He closes the door and walks through his dark foyer; he carries a brown bag. He switches on the light and, walking past his spiral staircase, past several framed pictures on the wall, he makes his way to his living room coffee table. Mickey pulls a crucifix out of the bag; he looks at it, then puts it on the table near a pile of books and some objets d'art. He then takes out a copy of the New Testament, putting it on top of the crucifix. Then out comes a framed picture of a saint. It too gets put on the growing pile. Next comes a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a large jar of Hellman's mayonnaise. Mickey sets them on top of the saint. Lee is walking down the street, looking around her. She passes some office buildings, a store's large display window; she stops when she sees Hannah. Her sister is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant; she's looking in the opposite direction. Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder; Hannah, surprised, turns and gasps. She turns and walks towards the restaurant entrance.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Mickey, responding, strikes his brow and begins pounding the portal again as the film cuts to a lovely snow-covered chapel downtown, complete with courtyard and wrought-iron railing. A passerby strolls by with an umbrella. The melody continues as the movie transitions inside, where the chorale is observed singing behind an altar glowing warm gold. A relatively large assembly sits in shadowy benches as the movie cuts to the back, where Mickey, his arms folded, stands beneath some stained-glass panes, observing and listening to the uplifting music. The chorale continues to sing as the movie cuts to Father Flynn in his study. He lifts up some large, heavy volumes from a ledge near his window and strides over to Mickey, who's standing near his desk, already holding several tomes. Father Flynn places the volumes on top of Mickey's stack; Mickey, flipping through the top one, clumsily carries his bundle to the door. Next is seen a close-up of a painting of Jesus Christ on the cross, complete with crown of thorns and sacred expression. The hymn plays on, loudly, as the lens moves back, revealing Mickey, standing outside a barber shop window, gazing at the Christ, swaying and shifting from side to side to achieve its eyes' 3-D effect. Mickey turns from the window, shrugging, and begins to stroll down the avenue, past a fruit and vegetable market with open-air-displayed blossoms, past several briskly moving passersby. With the hymn still playing, the screen goes dark momentarily. Mickey opens the portal, the light from a corridor illuminating him. He's just entered his flat. He closes the portal and walks through his dim foyer; he carries a brown sack. He switches on the light and, walking past his winding staircase, past several framed images on the wall, he makes his way to his parlor coffee table. Mickey pulls a crucifix out of the sack; he looks at it, then places it on the table near a stack of volumes and some objets d'art. He then takes out a copy of the New Testament, placing it on top of the crucifix. Then out comes a framed image of a saint. It too gets placed on the growing pile. Next comes a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a large jar of Hellman's mayonnaise. Mickey sets them on top of the saint. Lee is strolling down the avenue, glancing around her. She passes some office edifices, a store's large display window; she halts when she sees Hannah. Her sibling is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a bistro; she's looking in the opposite direction. Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder; Hannah, astonished, turns and gasps. She turns and walks towards the restaurant entry.

An umbrella is carried by a pedestrian walking by. The music is continued as the film is moved inside, where the choir sings behind an altar glowing warm gold. A fairly large congregation is seen sitting in darkened pews as the film is cut to the back, where Mickey, his arms crossed, stands underneath some stained-glass windows, watching and listening to the inspiring music. The books are put on top of Mickey's pile by Father Flynn; Mickey, flipping through the top one, awkwardly carries his bundle to the door. Next, a close-up of a painting of Jesus Christ on the cross, complete with crown of thorns and holy expression, is seen. The hymn is played on, loudly, as the camera is moved back, revealing Mickey, standing outside a barber shop window, looking at the Christ, playing and shuffling from side to side to get its eyes' 3-D effect. He turns from the window, shrugging, and the street is started to be walked down by him, past a fruit and vegetable store with open-air-displayed flowers, past several briskly moving pedestrians. The screen is briefly made black with the hymn still playing. The door is opened by Mickey, and the light from a hallway illuminates him. His apartment has just been entered by him. The door is closed by him and he walks through his dark foyer; a brown bag is carried by him. The light is switched on by him and, walking past his spiral staircase, past several framed pictures on the wall, his way to his living room coffee table is made by him. A crucifix is pulled out of the bag by Mickey; it is looked at by him, then put on the table near a pile of books and some objets d'art. Next, a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a large jar of Hellman's mayonnaise come out. They are set on top of the saint by Mickey. Lee walks down the street, looking around her. Some office buildings are passed by her, along with a store's large display window; she stops when Hannah is seen by her. Her sister is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant; she's looking in the opposite direction. Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder; Hannah, surprised, turns and gasps. She turns and walks towards the restaurant entrance.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Mickey hits his forehead and pounds the door as the scene shifts to a snow-covered church downtown. A pedestrian passes by with an umbrella. Inside, a choir sings behind a warm-gold altar, with a large congregation in dark pews. Mickey stands at the back, listening, arms crossed. The film cuts to Father Flynn, who collects heavy books and hands them to Mickey, adding to his stack. Mickey awkwardly carries the load to the door. The scene shows a close-up of a painting of Jesus on the cross. The hymn plays loudly as Mickey, outside a barber shop, gazes at it, noting its 3-D effect. He shrugs and walks past a store displaying flowers and brisk pedestrians. The screen briefly goes black. Mickey enters his apartment, a hallway light illuminating him. He walks through the dark foyer, carrying a brown bag, switches on the light, and reaches his living room. He places a crucifix, New Testament, and framed saint picture on the table, followed by a loaf of Wonder Bread and Hellman's mayonnaise. Lee walks down the street, stops upon seeing Hannah outside a restaurant, and surprises her with a tap on the shoulder. Hannah turns and heads to the restaurant entrance.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Mickey hits his forehead, pounding the door as the scene shifts to a snow-covered downtown church with courtyard and fence. A pedestrian passes by. Inside, a choir sings behind a glowing altar while a large congregation sits. Mickey stands under stained-glass windows, listening. Father Flynn picks books and places them on Mickey's pile, who awkwardly carries them to the door. A close-up shows Jesus on the cross while Mickey outside a barber shop examines its 3-D effect. Mickey shrugs and walks down the street past pedestrians and a vegetable store. The hymn plays as the screen goes black; Mickey enters his apartment with a brown bag. He switches on a light, passes a staircase and pictures, reaching his coffee table. He places a crucifix from the bag, then the New Testament on top, followed by a saint's picture. He adds a loaf of Wonder Bread and a jar of Hellman's mayonnaise. Lee walks past buildings, stops at a restaurant where her sister Hannah waits. Lee taps Hannah, who turns surprised, and heads towards the entrance.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Mickey, reacting with frustration, hits his forehead with an audible slap and begins pounding on the door once more. As this scene unfolds, the movie transitions to a breathtakingly beautiful, snow-covered church located in the heart of downtown. The church is complete with an elegantly designed courtyard and encircled by a classic wrought-iron fence. As a pedestrian strolls by, a protective umbrella in hand, the melody of the music persists, seamlessly guiding the audience into the church's interior. Inside, the camera captures the choir harmoniously singing behind an altar that glows with a warm, golden light. A fairly large congregation is seated attentively in the shadowed pews, adding to the solemn atmosphere. The film then cuts to the back of the church, where Mickey stands with his arms crossed beneath the vibrant stained-glass windows, intently watching and listening to the moving and inspiring music.

The choir's singing continues as the scene shifts to Father Flynn, who is in his office. He reaches for a collection of large, weighty books from a shelf positioned near his window and then carries them over to where Mickey is standing, by the desk. Mickey is already holding a precarious stack of hefty tomes. Father Flynn gently places the additional books on top of Mickey's existing pile. Mickey, opening the top book with some difficulty, awkwardly manages to carry his burden toward the door. The next scene presents a close-up view of a painting depicting Jesus Christ on the cross, adorned with a crown of thorns and conveying a reverent, holy expression. The hymn plays on, resounding loudly, as the camera gradually pulls back, revealing Mickey standing outside a barber shop window. He is gazing intently at the image of Christ, moving and shuffling from side to side as he seeks to perceive its three-dimensional effect. Mickey then turns away from the window with a shrug and begins walking leisurely down the street. He passes by a fruit and vegetable store, which has flowers displayed in an open-air setting, and moves past several pedestrians who are walking briskly.

With the hymn still resonating in the background, the screen momentarily fades to black. Mickey then opens the door to his apartment, and the light from the hallway casts an illuminating glow on him as he enters. After closing the door behind him, he navigates through his dimly lit foyer carrying a brown bag. He switches on the light and proceeds past a spiral staircase and several framed pictures adorning the walls, finally reaching his living room coffee table. From the bag, Mickey retrieves a crucifix, looks at it thoughtfully, and places it on the table next to a pile of books and some objets d'art. He then takes out a copy of the New Testament and sets it atop the crucifix. Subsequently, he pulls out a framed picture of a saint, which he also places on the steadily growing pile. Lastly, he extracts a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a substantial jar of Hellman's mayonnaise, setting these items on top of the saint's picture.

Meanwhile, Lee is seen walking down the street, casting her gaze around her surroundings. She passes by some office buildings and a store with an expansive display window. Her steps halt when she catches sight of Hannah, who is standing outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant with an air of expectancy. Hannah is looking in the opposite direction. Lee reaches out and taps Hannah on the shoulder. Startled, Hannah turns, gasping in surprise. With a sense of urgency, she turns and starts walking toward the entrance of the restaurant.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Mickey, overwhelmed and reacting with clear frustration, strikes his forehead with a deliberately loud slap and resumes pounding on the sturdy door once more. As this particular scene unfolds, the movie seamlessly transitions to a breathtakingly beautiful and picturesque snow-covered church, which is located right in the heart of downtown. This exquisite church is complete with a gracefully and elegantly designed courtyard, encircled by an iconic and classic wrought-iron fence. As a solitary pedestrian leisurely strolls by, clasping a protective umbrella in hand, the melody of the enchanting music persists, seamlessly guiding the audience into the church's sacred interior. Inside, the camera skillfully captures the choir harmoniously singing behind a majestic altar that glows with a warm, golden light. A fairly large congregation is seated attentively in the shadowed wooden pews, enhancing the solemn and sacred atmosphere. The film then smoothly cuts to the back of the church, where Mickey stands with his arms firmly crossed beneath the vibrant stained-glass windows, intently watching and listening to the moving and inspiring music.

The choir's singing continues to resonate as the scene shifts to Father Flynn, who is situated within his cozy office. He reaches for a collection of large and weighty books from a shelf situated near his tall window and then carries them over to where Mickey is standing, by the sturdy wooden desk. Mickey is already holding a precarious stack of hefty tomes. Father Flynn gently places the additional books on top of Mickey's existing pile. Mickey, opening the top book with some difficulty, awkwardly manages to carry his cumbersome burden toward the door. The next scene presents a close-up view of a detailed painting depicting Jesus Christ on the cross, adorned with a crown of thorns and conveying a reverent, holy expression. The hymn plays on, resounding loudly and beautifully, as the camera gradually pulls back, revealing Mickey standing outside a nearby barber shop window. He is gazing intently at the image of Christ, moving and shuffling from side to side as he seeks to perceive its three-dimensional effect. Mickey then turns away from the window with a nonchalant shrug and begins walking leisurely down the bustling street. He casually passes by a fruit and vegetable store, where vibrant flowers are displayed in a charming open-air setting, and moves past several pedestrians who are walking briskly by.

With the hymn still resonating softly in the background, the screen momentarily fades to black before transitioning to the next scene. Mickey then opens the door to his apartment, and the light from the hallway casts an illuminating, warm glow on him as he enters. After closing the door securely behind him, he navigates carefully through his dimly lit foyer while carrying a brown bag. He switches on the light and proceeds past a spiral staircase and several beautifully framed pictures adorning the walls, finally reaching his living room coffee table. From the bag, Mickey carefully retrieves a crucifix, looks at it thoughtfully and contemplatively, and gently places it on the table next to a pile of books and some objets d'art. He then takes out a copy of the New Testament and sets it with care atop the crucifix. Subsequently, he pulls out a framed picture of a saint, which he also places on the steadily growing pile. Lastly, he extracts a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a substantial jar of Hellman's mayonnaise, setting these items on top of the saint's picture.

Meanwhile, the scene shifts to show Lee, who is seen walking down the street, casting her curious gaze around her bustling surroundings. She passes by some tall office buildings and a store with an expansive, eye-catching display window. Her brisk steps come to a halt when she suddenly catches sight of Hannah, who is standing outside the Art Deco facade of a stylish restaurant with an air of expectancy. Hannah is intently looking in the opposite direction. Lee reaches out and gently taps Hannah on the shoulder. Startled, Hannah turns, gasping in surprise. With a sudden sense of urgency, she turns and starts walking quickly toward the entrance of the restaurant.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mickey, upon experiencing a surge of emotion, instinctively reacts by bringing his hand up to hit his forehead in frustration, before redirecting his energy to vigorously pound on the door once more. The scene transitions abruptly to showcase a serene, picturesque setting of a snow-covered church nestled in the heart of downtown, complete with a charming courtyard and an ornate wrought-iron fence. As this tranquil image unfolds, a solitary pedestrian, sheltered by an umbrella, ambles by, while the music continues to play. The focus then shifts to the interior of the church, where the choir is captivatingly performing behind an altar that radiates a warm golden glow. Meanwhile, a fairly large congregation occupies the dimly lit pews, absorbed in the moment as Mickey makes his presence known at the back. He stands with his arms crossed, positioned beneath the vibrant, colorful light filtering through stained-glass windows, as he intently watches and listens to the soul-stirring music. The choir's harmonious singing persists, leading the narrative to Father Flynn, who is positioned within the confines of his office. He decisively selects several large, weighty books from a shelf located near his window and purposefully strides towards Mickey, who waits by the desk, already burdened with his own collection of tomes. Father Flynn methodically places the books atop Mickey's existing pile, after which Mickey begins to flip through the top tome, struggling slightly as he awkwardly maneuvers the entire bundle towards the door. The scene then transitions to a close-up view of a painting depicting Jesus Christ on the cross, crowned with thorns and exuding a holy expression. As the accompanying hymn crescendos, the camera gradually recedes, unveiling Mickey standing outside a barber shop window. He is transfixed by the painting of Christ, shifting his body from side to side in an attempt to perceive its eyes' 3-D effect. Following a slight shrug of bemusement, Mickey pivots away from the window and embarks on a walk down the street. He moves past a bustling fruit and vegetable store that displays an array of open-air flowers, continuing his path alongside several pedestrians moving briskly along the sidewalk. As the hymn continues to resonate, the screen momentarily fades to black. The next instant reveals Mickey as he pushes open a door, the glow from the hallway illuminating his entrance into his apartment. He closes the door with finality and proceeds to traverse the darkness of his foyer, all the while clutching a brown bag. Upon switching on the light, he walks past the elegant spiral staircase and the wall adorned with framed pictures, making his way to the coffee table in his living room. Mickey carefully retrieves a crucifix from the bag, examines it momentarily, and places it on the table beside a pile of books and various objets d'art. He then extracts a copy of the New Testament, gently placing it atop the crucifix. Next, he retrieves a framed picture of a saint from the bag, adding it to the growing assemblage. The culmination of his unpacking reveals a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a sizable jar of Hellman's mayonnaise, which he places atop the picture of the saint. Meanwhile, Lee is seen making her way along the street, casting curious glances around her as she passes office buildings and examines a store's expansive display window. Her progress halts as she spots Hannah, her sister, standing expectantly outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant, facing away in the opposite direction. Lee extends her hand to tap Hannah on the shoulder, eliciting a surprised gasp as Hannah turns to face her. Without missing a beat, Hannah pivots and begins walking towards the entrance of the restaurant.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Mickey reacts by hitting his forehead and pounding the door. The scene transitions to a serene, snow-covered church downtown. Inside, a choir sings behind a glowing altar, observed by a large congregation. Mickey stands at the back, arms crossed, beneath stained-glass windows, listening intently. The film then moves to Father Flynn in his office, picking large books from a shelf. He hands them to Mickey, who already holds several tomes. Mickey awkwardly carries the pile to the door. The film shows a painting of Christ on the cross, then reveals Mickey outside a barber shop, studying the image's 3D effect. He shrugs and walks down the street past a fruit and vegetable store and pedestrians as the hymn plays. The screen briefly goes black before Mickey enters his apartment, illuminated by hallway light. He walks through the foyer carrying a brown bag, switches on the light, and proceeds to the living room. Mickey places a crucifix, a copy of the New Testament, a framed saint's picture, a loaf of Wonder Bread, and a jar of Hellman's mayonnaise on the coffee table. Meanwhile, Lee walks down the street, passing office buildings and a store window, until she spots Hannah outside a restaurant. Surprised, Hannah turns when Lee taps her shoulder, and then walks toward the restaurant entrance.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Mickey, reacting with frustration reminiscent of a character in a silent film, hits his forehead and starts pounding the door again as the movie cuts to a beautiful snow-covered church in the historic district downtown, complete with a courtyard and wrought-iron fence designed in the Victorian era. A pedestrian walks by with an umbrella, a common sight in the city known for its sudden downpours. The music continues as the film moves inside, where the choir, known for winning regional competitions, is seen singing behind an altar glowing warm gold. A fairly large congregation sits in darkened pews in a church renowned for its annual holiday services as the film cuts to the back, where Mickey, his arms crossed, stands underneath some stained-glass windows crafted by a famous artisan, watching and listening to the inspiring music. The choir continues to sing as the movie cuts to Father Flynn, a well-respected community leader, in his office. He picks up some large, heavy theological books from a shelf near his window and walks over to Mickey, who's standing near his desk, already holding several tomes related to church history. Father Flynn puts the books on top of Mickey's pile; Mickey, flipping through the top one that discusses the synoptic gospels, awkwardly carries his bundle to the door. Next is seen a close-up of a painting of Jesus Christ on the cross, complete with crown of thorns, an artwork donated by a parishioner and known for its expressive details and holy expression. The hymn plays on, loudly, as the camera moves back, revealing Mickey, standing outside a barber shop window known for its nostalgic charm, looking at the Christ, playing and shuffling from side to side to get its eyes' 3-D effect. Mickey turns from the window, shrugging, and starts to walk down the street, past a popular fruit and vegetable store with open-air-displayed flowers, past several briskly moving pedestrians heading to a nearby market. With the hymn still playing, the screen goes black briefly. Mickey opens the door, the light from a hallway illuminating him. He's just entered his apartment, located on the bustling third floor of a pre-war building. He closes the door and walks through his dark foyer; he carries a brown bag. He switches on the light and, walking past his spiral staircase, past several framed pictures on the wall depicting family and friends, he makes his way to his living room coffee table, an antique piece from the 1920s. Mickey pulls a crucifix out of the bag; he looks at it, then puts it on the table near a pile of books and some objets d'art, collectibles from his travels. He then takes out a copy of the New Testament, putting it on top of the crucifix. Then out comes a framed picture of a saint, known for his charitable works. It too gets put on the growing pile. Next comes a large loaf of Wonder Bread, an iconic American brand, and a large jar of Hellman's mayonnaise, famous for its creamy consistency. Mickey sets them on top of the saint. Lee is walking down the street, looking around her. She passes some office buildings, a store's large display window showcasing the season's fashion; she stops when she sees Hannah. Her sister is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant well-known for its classic interior; she's looking in the opposite direction. Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder; Hannah, surprised, turns and gasps. She turns and walks towards the restaurant entrance.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. he makes his way to his living room. coffee table. Mickey pulls a crucifix out of the bag. he looks at it then puts it on the table near a pile of books and some objets d'art. He then takes out a copy of the New Testament putting it on top of the crucifix. Then out comes a framed picture of a saint. It too gets put on the growing pile. Next comes a large loaf of Wonder Bread and a large jar of Hellman's mayonnaise. Mickey sets them on top of the saint. Lee is walking down the street looking around her. She passes some office buildings. a store's large display window. she stops when she sees Hannah. Her sister is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant. she is looking in the opposite direction. Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder. Hannah surprised turns and gasps. She turns and walks towards the restaurant entrance.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Mickey reacting hits his forehead and starts pounding the door again as the movie cuts to a beautiful snowcovered church downtown complete with courtyard and wroughtiron fence. A pedestrian walks by with an umbrella. The music continues as the film moves inside where the choir is seen singing behind an altar glowing warm gold. A fairly large congregation sits in darkened pews as the film cuts to the back where Mickey his arms crossed stands underneath some stainedglass windows watching and listening to the inspiring music. The choir continues to sing as the movie cuts to Father Flynn in his office. He picks up some large heavy books from a shelf near his window and walks over to Mickey who is standing near his desk already holding several tomes. Father Flynn puts the books on top of Mickey's pile. Mickey flipping through the top one awkwardly carries his bundle to the door. Next is seen a closeup of a painting of Jesus Christ on the cross complete with crown of thorns and holy expression. Lee is walking down the street looking around her. She passes some office buildings. a store's large display window. she stops when she sees Hannah. Her sister is waiting outside the Art Deco facade of a restaurant. she is looking in the opposite direction. Lee taps Hannah on the shoulder. Hannah surprised turns and gasps. She turns and walks towards the restaurant entrance.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Timothy, chuckling, scratches his knee and starts sketching the wall again as the play shifts to a serene palm-covered castle uptown, adorned with verandas and wooden gates. A cyclist rides past with a kite. The melody persists as the story unfolds inside, where the dancers are observed leaping behind a stage glowing soft silver. A fairly diverse audience sits under dimmed chandeliers as the scene switches to the back, where Timothy, his arms akimbo, leans beneath some mosaic skylights, observing and absorbing the motivating rhythm. The dancers continue to leap as the film transitions to Captain Roberts in his studio. He grabs some tiny, light papers from a drawer near his lamp and strolls over to Timothy, who's leaning near his chair, already grasping several scrolls. Captain Roberts places the papers atop Timothy's stack; Timothy, peeking through the top scroll, clumsily lugs his collection to the exit. Next appears a close-up of a sculpture of a Greek goddess, complete with olive wreath and serene demeanor. The ballad continues, loudly, as the lens pulls back, revealing Timothy, standing outside a toy shop showcase, gazing at the goddess, juggling and shifting from foot to foot to achieve its gaze's 3-D impression. Timothy pivots from the glass, sighing, and begins to stroll down the boulevard, past a clothing boutique with vividly-displayed scarves, past several hastening cyclists. With the ballad still resonating, the frame fades to black momentarily. Timothy unlocks the gate, the glow from a corridor casting light on him. He's just stepped into his studio apartment. He shuts the gate and strides through his gloomy entryway; he holds a blue backpack. He flicks on the lamp and, treading past his twisted ladder, past various mounted paintings on the partition, he progresses to his parlor counter. Timothy extracts an amulet from the backpack; he examines it, then places it on the counter near a heap of maps and some souvenirs. He then retrieves a copy of an ancient scroll, resting it atop the amulet. Then emerges a framed photograph of a mythical creature. It too is placed on the enlarging stack. Next comes a hefty bunch of silk fabric and a large container of coconut oil. Timothy places them atop the creature. Dana is strolling down the pathway, glancing about her. She edges past some skyscrapers, a mall’s grand display front; she halts upon spotting Eliza. Her sibling is stationed outside the Victorian facade of a cafe; she’s gazing in the opposite way. Dana nudges Eliza on the arm; Eliza, startled, pivots and exclaims. She turns and advances toward the cafe entrance.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Mickey hits his forehead and pounds on a door as the scene shifts to a snow-covered church downtown, where a choir sings behind a golden altar. Mickey stands at the back, listening. The film cuts to Father Flynn in his office, handing Mickey heavy books. Mickey awkwardly carries them to the door, and the scene shifts to a painting of Jesus, with Mickey outside a barber shop admiring the artwork. As the hymn continues, Mickey leaves the shop and walks past pedestrians and store displays before entering his apartment with a brown bag. Inside, he places a crucifix, a New Testament, and a saint's picture on a table, followed by Wonder Bread and mayonnaise. Meanwhile, Lee walks down the street, noticing her sister Hannah outside a restaurant. Lee taps Hannah's shoulder, surprising her, and they walk towards the entrance together.
